item.description:
This is the last of the Goethe Institut's series of German films at the Coolidge, all of which have been really interesting. We'll go to an area restaurant after the film for a discussion.

About Grave Decisions:
Eleven-year-old Sebastian, a bright, cheeky little scamp, sees life as one big adventure, yet believes he is responsible for his mother?s death because she died while giving birth to him. Apart from this ?homicide? ? a transgression for which his older brother Franz refuses to forgive him ? he has an array of other terrible misdeeds to answer for and has consequently become accustomed to battling the scourges of purgatory on a nightly basis.

dir. Marcus H. Rosenmüller, 1h42m, 35mm

Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Following the film I'll be near the exit holding a Meetup sign.
item.name: Grave Decisions (Wer Früher Stirbt ist Länger Tot)
